name: Popular Tea Cakes Workshop
description: Popular Tea Cakes Workshops We cover a variety of  of 5 various tea cakes that we teach from scratch. We use only the best of ingredients and source everything locally. We teach you how to bake cakes and the frostings that go with it, in a tradiotional method. Its a hands on experince and we provide the students with hand outs which they will be taking home with them.-Banana Cake with Dark Chocolate Chips-Sticky Toffee Date Cake with Salted Caramel Sauce -Carrot Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting -Orange Pound Cake Looking forward to baking the world a better place!

name: Eggless Cake Making Workshop
description: Weclome to our Eggless Cake Making Workshop!We teach you to bake your cakes to perfection with giving you a product thats so flavourful, you don't feel the absence of egg at all.What will you learn?-Eggless Vanilla Sponge -Eggless Chocolate Sponge -Couverture Chocolate Ganache -Salted Caramel -Whipping of Organic fresh cream (sourced from France) -Flavour Pairings (Caramel Chocolate Cake, Black Forest Cake, Classic Chocolate Cake , Fresh Cream Fruit Cake ).We make sure you embrace the art of baking and use the skills you will learn to best use.

name: Cheesecake Workshop
description: This class is for all the cheescake lovers. Here at Flourish, we teach you a variety of cheesecakes that range with technique and flavour. Tips, tricks and methods pertaining to perfecting your cheesecake is covered in this class. A variety of 3 cheesecakes is taught.-Baked New York Cheesecake -Frozen Fruit Cheesecake -Cotton Cheesecake (Japanese Cheesecake) All information regarding the baking of these widely different cheesecake will be passed on to our students. We provide you with all the ingredients, tools and know-how for the class including a handout which you will be taking home. Along with that, you will be taking the lovely cheesecakes you've made at the class, back home to your friends and family. Join us for a fun filled, cheese-centric workshop! Cheers!

name: Brownie Workshop
description: Join us in  baking two versions of a delectable Brownie. Everything we teach you is made from scartch. Tips, tricks and techniques required to perfecting your brownie is thoroughly taught at this class. Various ways to spice up your brownie with toppings and what combination works best! You will learn-An Eggless Brownie A Brownie with Egg Both versions of the brownie is fanatstic and you can't chose which one you like more!All ingredients are provided to you including the tools! We provide you with handouts as well which you will be taking home with you along with the brownies youve made yourself! Looking forward to a delectable class filled with chocolate and fun!

name: Food Nerd Festival - Immersives 2024 - Bangalore: All Day Pass
description: Food Nerd Festival is a celebration of all things food! So this festival is for anyone who’s obsessed with food! Whether you're a chef, foodie, flavour geek, or love to nerd out over the latest culinary trends and techniques, the Food Nerd Festival is your jam.With 4 workshops centred around the basic cooking elements, these immersives will leave you with an elevated culinary game.Salt by Chef Gautam & Bala (@gonzogarbanzo & @saltycuredpigs) (11-12:30)Guided Overview & History Of Preservation TechniquesExploring Techniques Of Pickling & Preserving In India & Around The WorldUnderstanding Curing Salts & The Science Behind ThemExpert Tips On Mastering Salt, Time, & FermentationLive Demonstration Of A Traditional Pickling TechniqueLive Demonstration Of A Meat Curing TechniqueRecipes For Pickling & Curing Bacon At HomeFat by Heena Punwani (@tiffintales, founder of Maska Bakery) (1:00-2:30)Cracking The Code Of Baking Theory: The Science Behind ItThe History Of Fats In CookingUnderstanding Different Fats In Indian BakingCookie Tasting Session Showcasing Different FatsOil Vs. Ghee: Flavor ShowdownLive Fat-Washing Cocktail DemoAcid by Payal Shah (@kobofermentery) (3:00-4:30)Exploring Indian Vinegars & Its Usage In Indian Cooking & HistoryLive Demonstration Of Vinegar Making.Breakdown Of The Science Behind The TechniqueA Vinegar-Tasting Experience of 5 vinegars.Hands-On Shrub-Based Drink MakingHeat by Chef Gresham Fernandes (@greshamfernandes) (5:00-6:30)Discover the Secrets of Heat SourcesUncover the chemistry behind how heat worksLearn the wonders of wood-fired cookingPro techniques for smoking foodUsing heat to create different textures: dry jerky vs fish roast. Disclaimer: Programming is subject to change, please watch out for an official email a few days before the actual workshop.

location.address: 105, Kengal Hanumanthaiah Rd, opp. Corporation Bank, Raja Ram Mohanroy Extension, Shanti Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560027, India

organizer.name: GOYA
organizer.description: Goya is a food & culture publication focussed on India & S Asia

name: Viva La Vino Wine Festival: Bangalore Edition
description: Viva La Vino - Bangalore EditionGet ready, Bangalore - The city’s most exciting wine, cheese, and chocolate festival is here! Co-curated by Sommeliers Gargi Kothari and Devati Mallick, Viva La Vino promises the best wines, great vibes, and unforgettable moments—no fuss, just pure fun. Experience an evening of tasting wines with old and new wine pals in a full-on festival setting! Whether you're new to wine or a seasoned pro, VLV will have you falling in love with the wine life all over again.What’s in store:60+ Wines from around the world! – Sip, swirl, and savour a curated lineup of Indian and international wines. Discover exciting new flavours from different corners of the world, scout for your new favourite wines, or revisit old classics with a twist. Taste & Buy – Loved a wine? We’ve got you covered! Get special prices on on-the-spot orders at the festival, which will be delivered later.Artisan Cheese & Chocolate – Heaven on a plate! Meet the makers behind some of the finest homegrown cheese and chocolate, perfect for pairing with the wines. Sample, chat, and take home your favourites at special prices.Exclusive Masterclass – 25 seats only! People who sign up for this will score access to a one-hour masterclass with industry experts, featuring premium wines not available at the festival (trust us, these are a must-try!)Music & Entertainment – A banging festival playlist to keep the vibes going all night while you sip, socialize, and explore!Live Food Stations – Indulge in mouthwatering bites at live stations curated by our venue partners—perfect for wine-ding down after all that serious tasting (phew!)!Wine Games & Trivia Zones – Ready for some fun? We’ve got interactive wine games that’ll test your wine knowledge and keep you entertained all evening. Whether you're into trivia, drinking games (wink wink!), or playful challenges, there’s something for everyone.Get your tickets now and join us for a wine-filled, fun-packed evening! Bring a friend, partner, a bunch of wine buddies or swing by on your own, but you can't miss this. #SeeyouatVLV?

location.address: Kumarakrupa Rd, opposite Golf Club, Kumara Park East, Seshadripuram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Viva La Vino
organizer.description: Welcome to VLV – the ultimate wine festival! Co-curated by Sommeliers Gargi Kothari (Magic Cellars) and Devati Mallick (Drink With D), VLV travels across 6 cities, celebrating wine, culture, and community. Join us for the best wines, fun vibes, and unforgettable memories. See you at #VLV?

name: MF DOOM & friends: Halloween Edition
description: MF DOOM, the legendary British-American rapper and producer, is renowned for his intricate lyrics, unique flow, and mysterious persona. His influence on underground hip-hop is unparalleled, and his work continues to inspire fans and artists worldwide. On Sunday, October 27, from 6 PM onwards, On The Jungle Floor is hosting MF DOOM & friends (Halloween Edition) at Indiranagar Social, Bangalore to pay homage to DOOM—this time through the rich, immersive sound of vinyl.DOOM tragically passed away on Halloween 2020, making this tribute all the more poignant as we celebrate his life and legacy. Joining us are Sachin Bhatt (aka "bhattchin") and Maddwax, longtime followers and collectors of DOOM, who have spent years building enviable collections of his rarest records, sourced from around the world. Whether you’re a new listener or a long-time fan, we suggest you throw on your best costumes and join us for what will be an unforgettable night!

location.address: Plot 37, 80 Feet Rd, Hal, HAL 3rd Stage, New Tippasandra, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560075, India

organizer.name: On the Jungle Floor LLP
organizer.description: Record Store, Music Discovery and Events

name: Rooting For Tubers Festival
description: Get ready, Bangalore! Rooting for Tubers is back and better than ever. This year’s festival brings you an exciting mix of food, culture, and nature, all wrapped up in the humble yet powerful tuber. It’s a fun, family-friendly day out, co-curated by Spudnik Farms and culinary creatives, to celebrate the vibrant world of tubers. Come with your friends, family, or even solo, and immerse yourself in a one-of-a-kind experience exploring flavours, traditions, and sustainability!Whether you're a food enthusiast, an eco-conscious eater, or someone looking for a relaxed picnic-style festival, Rooting for Tubers will leave you inspired and hungry for more!What’s in store:15+ Community & Market StallsExplore diverse stalls featuring local farmers, producers, and communities, all sharing unique tuber varieties and other farm-fresh produce. Discover exciting new ways to cook with tubers, support small-scale farmers, and stock up on your favourite finds at the market.  Interact and meet various tuber growing communities from across India!Culinary Stalls & Live CookingWatch chefs in action as they cook up delicious tuber-inspired dishes! Learn from the best as they explore tubers in creative and sustainable ways, showcasing the potential of these crops in modern cooking.Workshops & TalksLearn from experts in hands-on workshops, including fermentation, traditional cooking methods, and nutrition. Engage in conversations around biodiversity, sustainable food systems, and the cultural significance of tubers, while interacting with both culinary professionals and farmers.Art Installation & Tuber DisplayDelve into the artistic side of tubers through a collaborative art installation, featuring a colourful display of various indigenous tuber varieties. Discover the beauty and biodiversity of tubers while learning about the role they play in climate resilience and food security.

location.address: 5, Wheeler Rd, Cox Town, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560005, India

name: Barter Your Own Book Sundowner
description: Looking for your next great read? 📚 Join us for an evening where you’ll discover a new read, bond with fellow readers, and get to take a new book home!How it works?1️⃣ Bring a book wrapped in paper that you’re excited to share2️⃣ Add a teaser note to the cover to spark someone else’s curiosity3️⃣ We stack up the books and each one picks one that catches their eye from the pileOnce everyone has a new book in hand, we’ll unwrap them and dive into half an hour of silent reading. Afterward, we’ll gather to share our first impressions, swap stories about how these books found us, and enjoy some lovely evening tea and snacks.🗓️ Sunday, 27th October🕐 5 PM📍 Hey Brewty Studio, Ashok Nagar, Bangalore📣 Limited spots of 20. Sign up soon.

location.address: Hotel Ajantha, 22/A, Craig Park Layout, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Bookmark App
organizer.description: Bookmark is a dating app for readers. It connects people based on not just what books they like, but also other attributes and interests about their personality, distance, the relationship they are seeking, gender preferences, and more. Download and try it today!

name: The 100th Table Celebration!!
description: 🎉 100th Table Celebration: Where Connections Come to Life! 🍻We’re celebrating 100 tables of bringing strangers together and sparking endless conversations! From beer buddies 🍺 to travel pals ✈️, to friends who just get you—this milestone is all about celebrating the countless connections we've made over amazing meals. 🍽️✨For this special edition, we’re going BIG! Expect a new format with more people and even more opportunities to meet your future friends. The vibe? Think the more, the merrier! 🎊 Great food, flowing drinks, and loads of fun—it’s all on the menu for this celebration!Whether you’ve been with us from the start or it’s your first table, this is the event to jump in and experience the magic. Let’s eat, drink, connect, and make memories that will last beyond this 100th table!See you there! 🥂

location.address: Maratt Estate, Bannerghatta Rd, Dollar Layout, Phase 4, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

organizer.name: TwoTablesClub
organizer.description: Where a small group of strangers come together for genuine conversations & spontaneous connections  over a curated meal. Guided by a host every Table is a mix of locals & newcomers sharing stories of their roots & dreams

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, a new event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves. Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones). We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices (no laptops, ipads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table**Tickets are for entry and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter.

location.name: Copper + Cloves

name: Brew & Bite: The Ultimate Café Crawl
description: Attention coffee connoisseurs and food enthusiasts! 🌟Get ready for Blend's Brew & Bite – the ultimate cafe crawl experience in Bangalore! Join us on October 26th from 11 AM to 1 PM for an exclusive journey through MG Road's finest cafes. Discover hidden culinary gems, savor artisanal brews, and indulge in mouthwatering delights. 😋What's brewing?Expertly curated cafe tourExclusive tastings and demos Insider stories from local baristas Special offers and branded giveaways Unforgettable coffee experiencesDon't miss this chance to elevate your coffee game and explore Bangalore's vibrant cafe culture.

organizer.description: At Blend, we excel in spearheading innovation in Food, Fashion, and Fiction. Our portfolio comprises a diverse range of brands, and we specialize in tailoring unique experiences that seamlessly blend into their online presence.

name: Lucknow Lore
description: As our next pop-up, we bring to you Lucknow Lore by Gul AliGul Ali, the talent behind Gul’s Kitchen, brings 12 years of expertise in authentic Lucknowi cuisine. At her pop-up, indulge in her famous Lucknowi Raan, a slow-cooked, spiced leg of lamb, and the sweet, saffron-infused Maquti topped with dry fruits.Join us for this special pop-up, showcasing the rich flavors and techniques of Lucknowi cuisine, from its fragrant kebabs and delicate kormas to lesser-known Nawabi dishes that celebrate the city’s royal culinary heritage. MENU: Welcome drinkGulab SharbatStartersZaffrani Paneer TikkaMushroom ke GalautiGalouti KebabRaan MusallamFirst MainsArvi ka salan & Masa ki dal with Ulte Tawa ParathaMutton Nihari with Ulte Tawa ParathaSecond MainsKofta Biryani with Burani RaithaLucknowi Murgh Dum Biryani with Burani Raitha*Delicious, rich, Haleem served on the sideDessertsSheer kurmaMakutiMenu subject to slight changeTerms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked. Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. Incase you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: A story Walk through Cubbon Park
description: A STORY WALK through CUBBON PARKOn a Saturday morning ,walk through the greenery of the CUBBON PARK with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lesser known tales through the Folklore , Heritage and Ecology of the most visited public spaces of Bangalore . The walk will begin from the Cubbon Park Metro station . From tales of statues , buildings , people, masala vada ,trees and crows the tales shall take up on a path that we shall collectively create *Time* : 7 AM *Starting and Finish Point* : Will be updated on registration

name: yoga , breath work and sound healing
description: This truly optional experience includes a whole day curated for a meaningful , joyful one .The day begins with a light breakfast and we begin the yoga practice .After this is as session of dynamic breath work and meditation , followed by a nutritious sumptuous vegan meal. We have some free time to experience the space or be with yourself or have a chat . We also have a tarot reading at an extra charge for those of you who are interested. After this we will commence the soon healing session which will be an hour long .We end the day with some photo sessions and snacks and beverages.

name: Breathwork Journey with Maria
description: Conscious Connected Breathwork is a breathing technique and therapeutic practice that involves deep, rhythmic breathing consciously, for an extended period of time (50-60 minutes). By consciously connecting the inhale and exhale without pause, practitioners tap into the body's innate wisdom, unlocking stored emotions and releasing tension held within the subconscious mind.Here's Maria's message:" In this Breathwork journey we'll open our hearts and reconnect with joy, fun, and happiness. As we step into the final two months of the year, we’ll take a moment to acknowledge all we've been through and prepare ourselves for the most festive season ahead. Together, we'll create space to give and receive love, and embrace the remaining months with renewed energy and joy! We'll end with a powerful visualization meditation to call forth the best that this year still has to offer. "

name: Halloween Special Screening: Train to Busan (2016)
description: Halloween Special Screening: Train to Busan (2016)Join us at Courtyard for a thrilling Halloween experience with a special screening of Train to Busan (2016). Set in our Black Box Studio, the night promises an immersive atmosphere with just the right mix of fun and frights.Event HighlightsCostumes are a must, so get creative and bring your best Halloween look to match the festive fun! The space will be decked out with some seriously cool Halloween decor to set the perfect vibe for the night.Food & Drinks (Available to order on à la carte basis)Snacks by Chef Mathew Thomas, featuring:Mummied PizzasSausage MummiesEvil QuichesRIP CupcakesDrinks:Beer by Bira 91Wine curated by Wine in Progress More about the movie:Train to Busan (2016) is a gripping South Korean action-horror film that follows a group of passengers on a high-speed train from Seoul to Busan during a sudden outbreak of a deadly zombie virus. As chaos ensues, the survivors must fight to stay alive while the infection spreads rapidly, turning those affected into ravenous, fast-moving zombies.At the heart of the story is Seok-woo, a workaholic father, traveling with his young daughter to Busan to visit her mother. Along with other passengers, they face harrowing challenges, where human instincts—both noble and selfish—are put to the test. Combining intense action with emotional depth, Train to Busan explores the bonds of family, sacrifice, and survival in a race against time.Come enjoy a night of captivating cinema, delicious bites, and festive fun—Halloween at Courtyard like never before!Note: This film is rated 'A' by the CBFC, meaning it is not suitable for children.Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.Seating is based on first come first serve basis.The Event is taking place at Courtyard's indoor Studio space on the second floor.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.

name: The Indian Gin Odyssey
description: Kick off your Diwali celebrations with your gin-loving tribe! 💫Join us for a guided gin tasting experience where you’ll sample a variety of indigenous Samsara gins. Sip your way through history, learn quirky facts, and uncover the unique journey that makes each gin an experience to savour!​​What can you expect?​🍸 Sip and savour 5 different Samsara gins ​🍋 Breathe in the aromas and savour each sip as you explore their origins and untold stories​📝 Discover the perfect garnish pairings, jot down your tasting notes and reflect on the flavours​🍹 Craft 2 unique gin cocktails with our expert mixologist and experiment with exciting ingredients​🌮 Enjoy your drinks with delicious appetisers

From lively cookalongs and gourmet tastings to immersive creative activities and wellness pursuits, Jamberry Experiences offers something special for everyone.

name: Hip Opening Workshop by Shikha
description: "Feel Your Flow: Unlocking Fear & Emotional Energy Through Hip Openers"Initial 10-15 minutes	-Introduction, intention setting, theory on the Sacral chakra (associated with hips) and how its linked, its physical and emotional consequences on our bodies physically, mentally & emotionallyHip opening flow-60 minutes Partner assisted asana’s to encourage trust and confidence-15 minutesGuided Yoga nidra-15 minutesClosing circle-10 minutes -participants can share their experience of the emotional release during the class and overall workshop experienceAbout ShikhaHailing from the yoga capital, learned from her spiritual master and teaching for over a decade. Registered Yoga Teacher (yoga alliance approved)Masters in YogaReiki healer (level2)Shikha is visiting Bangalore for a short time only and we are honoured that she is able to teach us this hip-opening workshop at our beautiful studio.

name: The Picnic Table by Geist Brewing Co. Hennur
description: Indulge in classic dishes that will have you reminiscing about simpler times. We've got a spread of nostalgic favourites alongside refreshing beers and wines – something to please all palates! But this isn't just a trip down memory lane. It's a chance to create new memories with loved ones in the vibrant green space of our restaurant. Join us for a day of delicious food, good company, and a touch of sweet nostalgia!Food MenuBread ServiceHerb & Sundried Tomato FocacciaRustic Mini BaguetteSpreads & DipsThe Trio Jar: Marinated Labneh, Coriander & Peanut Pesto, Tomato ChundoHummus with Chilli Crunch & ZaatarChicken Liver PâtéSaladBarley, Bean & Beetroot Salad: Barley, roasted beetroot, curry ranch dressing, cucumber, cherry tomato, pomegranate, Granny Smith apple, orange segments, creamy labneh, lettuce & herbs, pumpkin seeds.Burgers & SandwichesCaprese Panini: Tomato chundo, oven-roasted tomato, bocconcini, coriander pesto, arugula, herbed paniniJerk Chicken Panini: Grilled jerk chicken, garlic coriander mayo, pineapple slaw, ciabatta.DessertsChocolate Ganache CakeBeverage MenuMocktail or Coolers: Tiki Taka or canned beveragesBeer: Witty Wit or Repeat (Growler 2L)Wine: Grover AC Rosé, Grover AC Sauvignon Blanc (375 ml each)Terms and Conditions1)Inclusions: Each ticket includes a picnic basket that serves 3-4 people, containing either food and mocktails or a 2L growler of beer or a 2L growler of beer and 2 bottles of wine (375ml each), depending on the ticket type purchased.2)Refunds and Cancellations: All ticket sales are final. No refunds or cancellations will be entertained.3)Alcohol Consumption: Attendees must be 21 years of age or older to consume alcoholic beverages. Valid ID proof will be required at the event.4)Weather Policy: The event will proceed rain or shine. In the case of severe weather, Geist Brewing Co. reserves the right to cancel the event. Ticket holders will be notified, and a refund or rescheduled date will be provided.5)Photography and Media: By attending the event, attendees consent to being photographed or filmed. Geist Brewing Co. reserves the right to use these images for promotional purposes.6)Food Allergies: Attendees with food allergies or dietary restrictions should inform the event organisers in advance.By purchasing a ticket, you agree to abide by these terms and conditions. We look forward to welcoming you to The Picnic Table by Geist for a memorable day of food and fun.
